bug.author: ShwetaSood
bug.description:
I am trying to replace vec.bin as per the blog: <denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/docs/tutorials/load-new-word-vectors>https://spacy.io/docs/tutorials/load-new-word-vectors</denchmark-link>
Code am using is as per the above cited link: from spacy.en import English nlp = English() n_dimensions = nlp.vocab.load_vectors('~/Downloads/GoogleNews-vectors-negative300.bin.gz') print n_dimensions The file to be loaded is Google News pre-trained model on this link: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/3Top/word2vec-api>https://github.com/3Top/word2vec-api</denchmark-link>
But it displays 0 as dimension. Am not able to resolve this. Please help!

comments.comment:
I'm getting a similar error. However, I start with a text file, one line per vector of the format: <denchmark-code>word_1 float_1 float_2 ... word_2 float_dim+1 float_dim+2 ... ... </denchmark-code>
The text file is then bzip'd and fed into spacy.vocab.write_binary_vectors("vec.bz2", "vectors.bin"). I then try to load vectors.bin as above and am informed that n_dimensions is 0.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
